Class DBSite

The replication site for Figaro High Availability (HA).

Inheritance

Namespace: Figaro
Assembly: Figaro.dll
Syntax
public class DBSite
Remarks

DBSite is used by the FigaroReplicationManager to manage and configure replication sites.

Address

Gets or sets a site's network address.

Declaration
public ReplicationHostAddress Address { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
ReplicationHostAddress
Remarks

The network address can be an IP address or a DNS name, and must include a port number.

View Source

BootstrapHelper

Specifies that a remote site may be used as a "helper" when the local site is first joining the replication group.

Declaration
public bool BootstrapHelper { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Boolean

False
Remarks

Once the local site has been established as a member of the group, this setting is ignored.

View Source

GroupCreator

Specifies that this site should create the initial group membership database contents, defining a "group" of just the one site, rather than trying to join an existing group when it starts for the first time.

Declaration
public bool GroupCreator { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Boolean

True
Remarks

This setting can only be used on the local site.It is ignored after the local site's initial startup and when configured for a remote site.

View Source

LegacyGroup

Specifies that the site is already part of an existing group.

Declaration
public bool LegacyGroup { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Boolean

False
Remarks

This setting causes the site to be upgraded from a previous version of Berkeley DB. All sites in the legacy group must specify this setting for themselves (the local site) and for all other sites currently existing in the group. Once the upgrade has been completed, this setting is no longer required.

View Source

LocalSite

Specifies that this site is the local site within the replication group.

Declaration
public bool LocalSite { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Boolean

False
Remarks

The application must identify exactly one site as the local site in this way, before starting the Replication Manager.

View Source

Peer

Specifies that the site may be used as a target for "client-to-client" synchronization messages.

Declaration
public bool Peer { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Boolean

False
Remarks

A peer can be either a client or a view. This setting is ignored if it is specified for the local site.
